name: optimization
brief: Optimization is the act of modifying or adjusting a variety of factors,\n in order to facilitate the execution of a task more effectively as defined by a measure.\nIf you are looking to optimize your streaming service look into the resource listed in the url tag.

name: usage
brief: To use nginx with RTMP streaming,\n you must open your broadcasting software and point to the IP of the system it is running on.\n For example if you are running nginx on your own system you would do rtmp://localhost/live_#streamkeyhere for more details see the details or obs and xsplit tags for info on configuring the respective broadcasting software.
details: nginx when started with /usr/local/nginx/sbin/nginx or start.sh will wait to receive connections from clients.\n to connect to your instance of nginx you need to set the custom rtmp option for your broadcasting software to the rtmp://#domain_or_ip/input_#streamkey url replacing the commented bits with what you set in /usr/local/nginx/conf/nginx.conf file

name: USER
brief: commented bit in the example config that needs to be replaced, see details for more.
details: #USER needs to be updated with the name of the user who will be streaming e.g: me

name: domain/ip
brief:
These commented bits are found as domain_or_ip in /usr/local/nginx/conf/nginx.conf
 need to be replaced/updated with the ip address of the machine running nginx which can be found by using ifconfig under eth0 -> inet 'address'.
 domain would be something like example.com or www.example.com, specifically the 'example' bit in the prior example.
 Domains can be set up using a variety of services like no-ip.com, get.tech, and dot.tk to name a few.
 It is reccomended to set and use a static ip when using a domain, although not necessarily required by all domain providers like no-ip.
 Local domain configurations can be done as well but require dns setup/configuration which is something that will not be covered in the documentation provided here

name: hls
brief: hls or http livestreaming as the name implies streams over http connections,\n this option is affected by what is configured in the http or https server blocks depending on whether http:// or https:// is used, see url tag for more directives
